original: MALMER, Ivar Valfrid, överdirektör, fd Professor, Stockholm, f Malma, Västml l, 12/9 84 av lantbr D Jansson o Alma Persson, gm Selma Rosenberg. Mog.ex Västerås 03, fil kand Upps 08, fil lic o fil dr Lund 15. E. lär o vik lär v allm lärov 07—10, lärov.adj i Växjö 11—15, assist o ch f tekn avd v AB Thulinverken i Landskrona 16—20, flygingenjör å Malmen 21—26, kontraktanst i Flygstyrelsen 26—30, docent i flygtekn vid KTH 19—30, spec.lär där 22—28, tf prof 28—30 o prof i flygtekn 30—12, tf Överdir o ch f Flygtekn försöksanst 40—42, överdir sed. *t2. Styr.led i Stat meteor-hydrogr anst sed. 33, led av nord luftfartskomm 19—21, av flygkomm 20—22, av luftfartssakk 28—29 o av flygsäkerh-utredn 29—31, utredn.man betr inrätt av flyktekn försöksanst 36—37. Censor i studex 34—10, insp vid h a lärov å Östermalm sed. 39. Led av drätselk i Växjö 15, styr.led i Lkrona kommunala gymn 19—20, internat luftfarts-utställn i Gbg 20—23. Ordf i Flygtekn Frn 34—36. Resor: Tyskl, Frankr, Engl o Holl uppr gg-r, Tjeckoslov 24, Bel s 25, Ital 29, USA 36. Av trycket: Bl a Untersuch iiber die Hoch-frekvenzspektra der Elemente» (grad.avh 15), »Flygmaskinen», »Flygmotorn» (tills m E Thulin 16), »Flygtekn lab» (28), »Teoret flyglära» (35) samt ett flert upps i fys o flygtekn ämn. RNO, RVO, RFinlVROlkl, LKr-Va, LIVA. Led Sv Tekn.frn. °MALMESTRÖM, Karl Bertil, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Gbg 17/12 96 av köpm K A M o Ester Weibull, gm Harriet Sandberg. CTI:s lägre avd 13—15, h avd 16—21 (E), ASEA:s elevkurs 21—23. Offert- o montageing v ASEA :s Gbgsfil 23—25, entreprenör o tekn led v Elektr AB Pergo Malmö 25—27, priv konsult ing Malmö 27—29, anst v Elektr Rådfrågn.byrån Sthlm sed. 29, deläg där sed. 30. Lett utför av hög- o lågspänn.anläggn, utarb försl t elektr anläggn f ett flert kommunala o priv byggnader mm. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated:
MALMER, Ivar Valfrid, Chief Director, former Professor, Stockholm, b. Malma, Västmanland county, September 12, 1884, son of farmer D Jansson and Alma Persson, m. Selma Rosenberg. Previously married in Västerås in 1903, Bachelor of Arts Uppsala 1908, Licentiate and Doctor of Philosophy Lund 1915. Substitute teacher and acting lecturer in elementary schools 1907-1910, teacher's assistant in Växjö 1911-1915, assistant and head of the technical department at AB Thulinverken in Landskrona 1916-1920, engineer at Malmen Air Base 1921-1926, contracted employee at the Air Staff 1926-1930, associate professor of aeronautical engineering at KTH 1919-1930, special lecturer there 1922-1928, acting professor 1928-1930, and professor of aeronautical engineering 1930-1942, acting Chief Director and Head of the Aeronautical Research Institute from 1940-1942, Chief Director since 1942. Board member of the State Meteorological-Hydrographic Institute since 1933, member of the Northern Aviation Committee 1919-1921, Aviation Committee 1920-1922, Aeronautics Research Board 1928-1929, and Aviation Safety Investigation Board 1929-1931, investigator on the establishment of the Aeronautical Research Institute 1936-1937. Examiner in the student examination 1934-1940, inspection of high schools in Östermalm since 1939. Member of the local council in Växjö in 1915, board member of the municipal gymnasium in Landskrona 1919-1920, international aviation exhibition in Gothenburg 1920-1923. Chairman of the Aeronautical Engineering Association from 1934-1936. Travel: Germany, France, England, and the Netherlands for study purposes, Czechoslovakia 1924, Belgium 1925, Italy 1929, USA 1936. Printed works include, among others, "Investigation of the High-Frequency Spectra of the Elements" (doctoral thesis 1915), "The Airplane", "The Aircraft Engine" (together with E Thulin 1916), "Aeronautical Engineering Laboratory" (1928), "Theoretical Aeronautics" (1935), as well as several essays in physics and aeronautical engineering. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Finnish Order of the White Rose of Finland, Västmanland County Badge, Uppsala County Badge. Member of the Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.

MALMESTRÖM, Karl Bertil, Engineer, Stockholm, b. Gothenburg, December 17, 1896, son of merchant K A M and Ester Weibull, m. Harriet Sandberg. Lower division of the Chalmers University of Technology 1913-1915, higher division 1916-1921 (studies abroad), apprentice course at ASEA 1921-1923. Offers and assembly engineer at ASEA Gothenburg branch 1923-1925, contractor and technical manager at Elektr AB Pergo Malmö 1925-1927, private consulting engineer in Malmö 1927-1929, employed at the Electrical Advisory Bureau in Stockholm since 1929, and co-owner there since 1930. Led the implementation of high and low voltage installations, developed proposals for electrical installations in several municipal and private buildings, etc. Member of the Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.
